> But, of course, since we're only testing through the public interface,
it's
> black-box testing by definition: "Tests that only use observable
behavior." The
> public interface *is* the observable behavior. (Well, not exactly, but
it's
> less wordy than the exact facts.)

There's yet another view on the black-box vs. white-box issue: In testing
literature bb and wb testing are often used as synonyms for
"specification-based testing" vs. "implementation-based testing". So in a
sense test-driven development is both:
- It's specification-based (black-box) because you *should* only use the
public interface
- It's implementation-based (white-box) because you must be aware of the
implementation to decide when a sufficient coverage level has been reached.

Johannes
